intro: Tupa mucronata var. hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's tupa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, palmate leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
